tags.value: Property located in El Zamorano, Honduras, near Escuela Agricola Zamorano, situated in a valley with favorable agricultural climate and average annual temperature of 21Â°C
Strategic position with access to Danli (45 minute drive) and Tegucigalpa (1 hour drive) markets, connected via well-maintained highway infrastructure
Total land area of 12.6 hectares, with 0.5 hectares of arable land identified for agricultural development, featuring gentle slope and good drainage characteristics
Substantial mahogany forest requiring sustainable management approach and zero environmental impact policy, potential for carbon credit programs
Masters degree in sustainable tourism
Multilingual proficiency in English, Spanish, and Italian, enabling international business relationships and market access, particularly valuable for export operations
Proven track record in managing and completing construction projects in the local area, with demonstrated ability to navigate local regulatory environment
16-meter water well with verified abundant supply, supporting year-round agricultural operations, with potential for expansion of irrigation systems
Owner's residence strategically located near agricultural operations, enabling efficient oversight and potential for future on-site processing facility
Established fruit trees including mango, lemon, tamarind, papaya, and banana, with trees ranging from 3-15 years in age, demonstrating soil fertility
Relationships with local markets and potential for direct-to-consumer sales through weekly farmers markets in surrounding communities
Access to combined urban market of over 1.2 million consumers through Tegucigalpa and surrounding areas
Phased introduction of high-value crops including specialty herbs, organic vegetables, and exotic flower varieties targeting premium market segments
Feasibility study completed for tilapia farming operation with potential annual production of 5000kg using sustainable aquaponics system
Initial capital requirement with preference for phased investment approach and exploration of agricultural grants
Complex regulatory environment requiring permits from Ministry of Agriculture and local authorities, with 6-month estimated timeline for full compliance
2.5km perimeter requiring security fencing
Initial requirement for organic certification compliant seeds, fertilizers, and soil amendments with established supplier relationships
Implementation of zero-waste agriculture principles, rainwater harvesting, and renewable energy systems for operations
Development of integrated farm management system incorporating IoT sensors, automated irrigation, and real-time monitoring
Comprehensive digital marketing strategy including e-commerce platform, social media presence, and content marketing focusing on sustainability story
Proposed partnership with Escuela Agricola Zamorano for research projects and student internships, with potential grant funding
Identified export opportunities to European organic markets with potential annual revenue of $200,000 by year three
Five-year growth strategy including vertical integration, value-added processing facility, and regional distribution network development
